intro: Swertia caerulea var. wattii, commonly known as the blue swertia, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Gentianaceae and is characterized by its striking blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in high-altitude meadows and rocky areas, preferring cool and moist conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged oppositely along the stem. The species is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been studied for its potential medicinal properties.
